lesson.description: HTML stands for Hyper Text Markup Language. It is the standard markup language for creating Web pages HTML describes the structure of a Web page and consists of a series of elements. HTML elements tell the browser how to display the content also its elements label pieces of content such as "this is a heading", "this is a paragraph", "this is a link", etc.

p: Allows us to write a paragraph within the tags, just like a description of a certain thing!

description

h: We can write our headers in here with the following order from the biggest to the smallest h1, h2, ... , h6.

header
a: This is a very useful tag that we can use to link to other web pages! we have to use the attribute href inorder to provide the link! link

nav: Simply defines navigation links and helps us navigate between different pages. <nav> Navigation Links </nav>
header: funstions as a header for a document or section of the page. <header> Document Header </header>
footer: Basically acts as a footer for a document or section of the page. <footer> Document Footer </footer>
section: This is where the general information of the page is usually stored. <section> Document Secotion </section>
article: Article is where the more detailed information about the page is stored. <article> Document Article </article>

assignment.description: Create a website using the tags p and a
